lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/FlyingNugget.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run FlyingNugget.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.

* Represents a Deadline task, which is a type of Task with a due date.
* The description is parsed from the user input.
* Creates a new Deadline task from the given description.
* @param description the user input containing the "deadline" keyword, task description, and due date
* @throws MissingTaskException if the task description and/or the due date is missing
* Extracts the task description and due date from the user input.
* @return the parsed task description and due date
* @throws MissingTaskException if the task description and/or the due date is missing
private static String[] parse(String description) throws MissingTaskException {
* Returns a string representation of the Deadline task.
* @return a string showing task type, completion status, task description, and due date
* Represents an Event task, which is a type of Task with a start date and end date.
* The description is parsed from the user input.
* Creates a new Event task from the given description.
* @param description the user input containing the "event" keyword, task description, start date, and end date
* @throws MissingTaskException if the task description, the start date, and/or the end date is missing
* Extracts the task description, start date, and end date from the user input.
* @return the parsed task description, start date, and end date
* @throws MissingTaskException if the task description, the start date, and/or the end date is missing
private static String[] parse(String description) throws MissingTaskException {
* Returns a string representation of the Event task.
* @return a string showing task type, completion status, task description, start date, and end date
* The FlyingNugget class is a task management chatbot
* that allows users to add/delete tasks and mark/unmark their completions.
* It supports Todo, Event, and Deadline tasks.
* The main entry point for the chatbot.
* Reads user input and performs actions like adding/deleting/marking/unmarking tasks
* and displaying the current list of tasks.
* @throws UnknownActionException if the user enters an unknown action
public static void main(String[] args) throws UnknownActionException {
lines.add("Sugoi desu! LittleNuggy finished LittleNuggy's task!");
lines.add("FlyingNugget does have LittleNuggy's task number!");
lines.add("(Ensure your mark is of the following format: \"mark [number]\".)");
lines.add("FlyingNugget does not see this task number in LittleNuggy's list!");
lines.add("(Type \"list\" to see all your current tasks and their numbers.)");
lines.add("FlyingNugget does have LittleNuggy's task number!");
lines.add("(Ensure your unmark is of the following format: \"unmark [number]\".)");
lines.add("FlyingNugget does not see this task number on LittleNuggy's list!");
lines.add("(Type \"list\" to see all your current tasks and their numbers.)");
lines.add("(Ensure your todo is of the following format: \"todo [task]\".)");
lines.add("(Ensure your deadline is of the following format: \"deadline [task] /by [dueDate]\".)");
lines.add("(Ensure your event is of the following format: \"event [task] /from [start] /to [end]\".)");
lines.add("FlyingNugget does have LittleNuggy's task number!");
lines.add("(Ensure your delete is of the following format: \"delete [number]\".)");
lines.add("FlyingNugget does not see this task number on LittleNuggy's list!");
lines.add("(Type \"list\" to see all your current tasks and their numbers.)");
lines.add("FlyingNugget has never heard that before!");
* Adds a task to the task list and prints its corresponding messages.
* @param task the Task object to add
* @param tasks the current list of tasks
* @param lines the current list of messages to print
private static void addTask(Task task, List<Task> tasks, List<String> lines) {
lines.add("Ok~! FlyingNugget will help LittleNuggy add this task!");
lines.add("Now LittleNuggy has 1 task on LittleNuggy's list!");
lines.add("Now LittleNuggy has " + tasks.size() + " tasks on LittleNuggy's list!");
* Deletes a task from the task list and prints its corresponding messages.
* @param taskNumber the index of the task to remove from tasks
* @param tasks the current list of tasks
* @param lines the current list of messages to print
private static void deleteTask(int taskNumber, List<Task> tasks, List<String> lines) {
lines.add("Ok~! FlyingNugget will remove this task for LittleNuggy!");
lines.add("Now LittleNuggy has 1 task on LittleNuggy's list!");
lines.add("Now LittleNuggy has " + tasks.size() + " tasks on LittleNuggy's list!");
* Prints all messages per action in an enclosed box with a tab indent.
* @param messages one or more strings to print in the box
* Thrown when a user input is missing a task description or does not follow the required format for the command.
/** Represents a Task which tracks an item and its completion state.
* This is the base class for Todo, Deadline, and Event.
* Creates a new Task with the item.
* By default, the task is not done.
* @param item the description of the task
* Returns the completion status of the task.
* @return true if the task is done, false otherwise
* Returns the description of the task.
* Marks the task as done and returns its string representation.
* @return the string representation of the task after marking it as done
* Marks the task as undone and returns its string representation.
* @return the string representation of the task after marking it as undone
* Returns a string representation of the task.
* Subclasses should override this to provide task-specific formatting.
* @return the string representation of the task
* Represents a Todo task, which is a type of Task without a specific deadline or event time.
* The description is parsed from the user input.
* Creates a new Todo task from the given description.
* @param description the user input containing the "todo" keyword and task description
* @throws MissingTaskException if no task description is provided
* Extracts the task description from the user input.
* @throws MissingTaskException if no task description is provided
private static String parse(String description) throws MissingTaskException {
* Returns a string representation of the Todo task.
* @return a string showing task type, completion status, and task description
* Thrown when the user enters an action that is not recognised by FlyingNugget.
